title: How much does a digital forensic investigator make yearly? - Quora
tags: Salaries for Specific Jobs and Careers

response.answer_text: You need to look at compensation tables like Glassdoor, Payscale, in your target area to get a better understanding of your particular market. Sites with “free information” tend to be overly generous while sites that involve pay as you go or subscription services such as ADP are highly accurate because they track career pay by actual employer payrolls. Nothing like going to the source. Keep in mind that digital forensics is meost likely going to be found in major metropolitan cities and state governments where salaries may appear at first glance quite respectable until you break down the cost of living. Always take into consideration the local market in IT as living in a major metropolitan area like Chicago or New York comes at a significant expense when your looking at hundreds, if not thousands in additional hidden costs, such as the 120 dollar annual fee in Chicago to own your own vehicle types of taxes, etc. Using the investigators favorite tool of all, the “search engine”, I immediately found a site that should answer your remaining questions.
